alert.note: Alert for Western King and Queen (Virginia) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Wakefield (Eastern Virginia and Southern Maryland)
info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued June 30 at 5:41PM EDT by NWS Wakefield
info.description: ...A strong thunderstorm will impact portions of northwestern King and Queen, east central Caroline and northwestern Essex Counties through 630 PM EDT... At 541 PM EDT, Doppler radar was tracking a strong thunderstorm near Bowling Green. This storm was nearly stationary. HAZARD...Wind gusts up to 50 mph and penny size hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down small trees and blow around unsecured objects. Wind impacting handling of high profile vehicles. Minor damage to outdoor objects is possible. This storm will remain over mainly rural areas of northwestern King and Queen, east central Caroline and northwestern Essex Counties, including the following locations... Supply, Sparta, Gether, Central Point and Salvia. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.75 IN MAX WIND GUST...50 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building.
